text: So it is safe to use x[:100].
Slicing and dicing sequences (including strings) is an important part of Python.
The following resources will come in handy:
Slicing of arrays is done with [start:end+1].
One trick I tend to use a lot of is to indicate extra information with ellipses.
So, if your field is one hundred characters, I would use:

code:
if len(s) <= 100:
    print s
else:
    print "%s..."%(s[:97]) # Yes, I know () is superfluous, it's just my style.

text: To answer Philipp's concern ( in the comments ), slicing works ok for unicode strings too

code:
>>> greek=u"αβγδεζηθικλμνξοπρςστυφχψω"
>>> print len(greek)
25
>>> print greek[:10]
αβγδεζηθικ
